full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 507 Filed 11/24/21 Page 14 of 28

B. The Bases of Dr. Hall's Opinions Are Not Independently Admissible

According to the defendant's expert notice, she also seeks to elicit the "bases" for the opinions in Dr. Hall's report. Because those opinions themselves should not be admitted for the reasons just discussed, there is no ground to admit their basis.

To start, all the summarized information about Minor Victim-4's past is hearsay or otherwise inadmissible. Dr. Hall was obviously not a percipient witness to any of the conduct discussed in his report, and instead derived his understanding of Minor Victim-4's past from out-of-court statements by Minor Victim-4 and others,

12
DOJ-OGR-00008055
